title: Cognitive Process Training Course for Physics Problem Solving [Self-Directed]

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core physics concepts (mechanics, electromagnetism, etc.)
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-based learning environment with limited technology, continuously monitoring learning outcomes via formative assessments.

learning_goals: Three or more cognitive processes required for interpreting scientific concepts can be explained and applied
The complementary use of quantitative/qualitative explanations in physics problem-solving can be performed with over 80% accuracy
A hierarchical approach to systematically organizing physics knowledge can be applied to new problem situations with over 70% success

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
